Crimes.Legal_Issue: Application of standard of proof and adequacy of reasons in refugee determination
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Refugee status determination with subsequent judicial review
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Inconsistent evidence not reconciled; benefit of the doubt applied without explanation
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution in China due to political opinion or activities
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to reconcile inconsistencies and justify acceptance of claims
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Decision set aside and referred back
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Clear, precise, and intelligible reasons required
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Lack of supporting evidence for key claims such as ITF complaints and fine amount
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasons must enable effective appellate review
Crimes.Application_Factor: Benefit of the doubt given without justification
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Adequacy of reasoning and application of burden of proof
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Duty to provide adequate reasons under administrative law
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Remanded for reconsideration by new panel
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony regarding fine and union complaints
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Concerns about transparency and accountability in decision-making
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Minister challenged RPD's failure to justify findings
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Administrative law principles on reasoned decisions

Crimes.Crime_Name: Possession of identification documents obtained by deception
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Sufficiency of reasons for accepting refugee claim despite deceptive documents
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Inconsistent testimony and lack of corroboration
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish well-founded fear
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Tribunals must justify reliance on implausible evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to address gaps in evidence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of persecution based on alleged ITF involvement
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Decision overturned due to inadequate reasoning
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Deficient due to lack of transparent analysis
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Testimony about $200,000 fine and union activity
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Claimed persecution but provided inconsistent accounts
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Case law on adequacy of reasons
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Oral testimony, absence of documentary support
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Misrepresentation and use of false documents
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Requirement for coherent and justifiable decision-making
